description.narrative:
The objective of the DUUNI project (duuni is a Finnish slang word meaning work) is to empower young parents from immigrant backgrounds to discover their skills and interests in order to find employment or educational opportunities. The project will be implemented in three cities with Finnish universities and NGOs. Caritas Finland implements the project in the Helsinki area with cooperation from NGOs specialized in providing cultural and other creative activities.
Many young people, particularly young women, who have become parents at a young age, are lacking education and work experience required by the job markets. However, they have other strengths, including skills developed through years of parenting. Many of the young parents can also be classified as NEETs (Not in Employment, Education or Training) and they are at a risk of permanent social marginalization. The goal of the project is to empower these young people to discover their skills and strengths, for example through cultural and sports activities, in order to support them to find their way either into further education or employment.
